message: 30 years ago today, I married my loving husband Ray Wagner at Ste. Genevieve du Bois Catholic Church. Please join me in wishing Ray a Happy 30th Anniversary! I'm really missing the style of the 80s!

A direct attack on our entire Jewish Community, this act of vandalism is despicable. To help our neighbors at Chesed Shel Emeth Cemetery, please visit this website: http://www.allnationschurch.net/give

Insurers have left the marketplace each year since #ObamaCare was put into effect, leaving a third of the country, including 96 of Missouri’s 114 counties, with only one provider to ‘choose’ from. ObamaCare has failed. How do we fix it? Missouri Republicans explain our plan for a #BetterWay.

St. Louis County Police Department Officer Blake Snyder was a true hero who selflessly put his own life on the line to protect our families, while leaving behind his own. It will be an honor to host his wife Elizabeth and her brother Justin in Washington for this historic event, as their strength, conviction and unwavering support for our first responders is nothing short of heroic. It is because of stories like theirs—positivity in the wake of tragedy—that will help close the divide between our communities and law enforcement.
Supporting the mission of law enforcement to keep our communities safe is a priority of President Trump’s, and we, as a nation, must come together to build stronger, safer communities.

The Department of Labor’s #FiduciaryRule is an egregious regulation that targets the pocketbooks of Americans who only have a little bit of money available to invest. It was designed to dictate the way you save your hard-earned income, but I believe all families—from coast to coast—should have a say in how and when you invest in your futures. Simply put, this regulation is like “cliff diving without a parachute.” The American people deserve true financial independence, not more government intrusion.

St. Louis County Police Officer Blake Snyder gave his life while protecting our community last October. Tonight I am honored that his wife, Elizabeth, and her brother, Justin, himself a police officer, are joining me for the President's #JointAddress to Congress. Their strength in the wake of tragedy and unwavering support for our first responders is exemplary for strengthening the ties between our communities and law enforcement. I am confident that under a unified Republican government, we, as a nation, will build stronger, safer communities, jumpstart our economy and get Americans back to work.

I was so happy that Elizabeth Snyder, the wife of fallen police officer Blake Snyder, and her brother Justin Sparks, a current St. Louis County Police Department Officer, were able to join us last night for President Donald J. Trump's Joint Address. The President spoke of unity and forward thinking, which is exactly what our country needs to strengthen the ties between our law enforcement and local communities. Elizabeth and Justin, in the wake of tragedy, have shown nothing but resilience and grace, exemplifying how we can and will build a stronger, safer nation.

Securing 14 new Super Hornets is absolutely critical to strengthening our national defense capabilities and ensuring the readiness of our war fighters. In addition to protecting our families from rising terrorist threats, funding for the jets will secure thousands of vital jobs in St. Louis and across Missouri. Recognizing the Navy’s operational aircraft shortfall, I have fought for Super Hornet funding each year I’ve been in Congress.

Human trafficking is a modern form of slavery that affects every community across our country. As part of The McCain Institute’s Human Trafficking Conversation Series, I joined a panel discussion with other policymakers at the National Association of Counties’ annual conference. We discussed ways to effectively fight trafficking and rescue victims at the federal and county levels. Watch below! #EndTrafficking

Washington’s outsized role in health care has limited choice, driven up costs, and diminished the quality of care Americans receive. Our unified Republican government is working to repeal #Obamacare and give you a patient-centered health care system:

Last week I was happy to tell Jacob Paule, a student at Oakville High School that he had been appointed to the United States Merchant Marine Academy! Congratulations to Jacob, his family and his teachers who made this possible!  If you’re from Missouri’s Second Congressional District and interested in military service, the nomination application period for the class of 2022 will open in early May 2017. More information can be found here: http://bit.ly/2mCF19v

Our military's F/A- 18 Super Hornets have seen their share of combat operations over the past ten years, conducting strikes in the fight against ISIS and providing air support to our troops on the ground in Afghanistan. This unrelentingly high operational tempo coupled with the delays in maintenance have resulted in a significant shortfall in tactical aircraft needed to remain mission capable.  The men and women building the F/A-18 in Missouri’s 2nd district are ready to deliver the tools our military needs. My constituents are fantastic and dedicated heroes who work hard to develop amazing systems that make American leadership in global missions possible.

Last evening I was thrilled to attend The Covering House's Red for Refuge Gala to celebrate the accomplishments the housing center's young women made in 2016. I remain committed to providing a voice for the voiceless, and this Gala is an example of how community involvement and support can help these young women overcome their past experiences of sexual exploitation and start down a path toward brighter futures.

It is going to be a cold night across the St. Louis region with temperatures getting down into the teens in some areas! Be sure to checkout this video from St. Louis County Emergency Management/LEPC on important safety tips when heating your home.

It was my honor to welcome a large number of women from the St. Louis area to Washington last week for Monsanto Company's Women’s Leadership Conference. As women, we’ve experienced the ups and downs of balancing professional leadership positions and our outside responsibilities - I know from experience the difficulty of making tough decisions while holding a baby on your hip! Did you know that women hold 52 percent of professional level jobs in the U.S. and 37 percent of small business owners are women? I was thrilled to meet these leading ladies and know that we have some pretty incredible role models for young girls in our community at home.

With more than 92,000 veterans receiving care from the St. Louis VA Health Care System, it’s critical that they get the best care possible. The VA Accountability First Act makes important reforms that will allow the VA’s leadership to fire or demote employees who fail to do their job. It brings a much needed private sector approach that will benefit veterans all across America, but particularly the more than 55,000 veterans living in Missouri’s Second District. As a daughter of a Korean War vet, and the mother of an Army Ranger, I can’t think of anything more important.

So proud of the hardworking 8th graders from the Ladue School District who are heading to the National Science Bowl Finals in Washington DC! Each year the Department of Energy hosts this competition to promote the future success in some of the world’s fastest growing fields of science, technology and engineering.   Launched in 1991, the National Science Bowl® (NSB) is a highly competitive science education and academic event among teams of high school and middle school students who compete in a fast-paced verbal forum to solve technical problems and answer questions in all branches of science and math.
I'm honored to lead the Oversight & Investigations Subcommittee this Congress - It is time we hold Washington accountable.  → http://bit.ly/F_S_C_
This morning I will convene my first House Committee on Financial Services Oversight hearing on the #CFPB's unconstitutional design. Watch live at 10 AM EST → bit.ly/F_S_C_

As I visited Officer Flamion in the hospital shortly after he was injured last summer, I knew we needed our community to rally around him and his wife Sarah. I have truly been inspired by the support you have shown him and our entire law enforcement community.   Today, more support arrived as we celebrated the groundbreaking of a new home for the Flamions just down the street from our Ballwin Police Department headquarters. I am so thankful for the Gary Sinise Foundation and their commitment to design and build a home fully equipped to meet the needs of Officer Flamion during his journey to recovery.

Yesterday I had the pleasure to meet with more than 80 hardworking farmers from Missouri. These members of the Missouri Farm Bureau are doing their best to promote economic growth across the state. I was thrilled to see so many familiar faces as I discussed the importance of global trade and my efforts to promote trade deals that are good for Missouri jobs. Did you know that in Missouri, one out of every three rows of crops is grown for exports? Trade deals are an opportunity to use American leverage to open up foreign markets for Missouri exports and ensure that all countries are engaging in free and fair trade. #mofbdc17

I was happy to meet with the Singapore Foreign Minister, Dr. Vivian Balakrishnan, last week to discuss American presence in the Asia Pacific. His message to Congress was that the United States must demonstrate strength and leadership in the region. As your representative, I will ensure we are working to protect our allies and partners and responding to regional threats.

Today at 10 AM → House Committee on Financial Services Oversight hearing on why we need to hold the Financial Stability Oversight Council more accountable and end tax-payer funded bailouts. Livestream here: bit.ly/F_S_C_

Despite the rain here in Washington DC, some of our nation’s heroes from the Greater St. Louis Area paid the Capital a visit. I am so grateful for the Greater St. Louis Honor Flight program and the many volunteers who dedicate their time to honor these brave veterans and the sacrifice they made to defend our freedoms.

I think I’ll join our very own Imo’s Pizza in celebrating National Mom and Pop Business Owners Day.   Small businesses are the key to a healthy local and national economy. I remember working in my father’s store, Carpetime, when I was younger and that experience helped me understand the value of hard work. Thank you to all of our dedicated entrepreneurs and for the important role your businesses play in our communities.

Whether it’s a family member, friend or loved one, unfortunately many Americans have been shaken by the effects of Alzheimer’s disease.  Yesterday, I met with members of the Alzheimer's Association, St. Louis Chapter to discuss the important research conducted by National Institutes of Health (NIH). Over 5 million Americans are living with Alzheimer’s disease and that number is expected to increase dramatically as our population ages. Because of this, it is imperative that we support the research the NIH carries out. I am proud to say that I will again this year be requesting that the NIH’s budget is increased so they can find cures and treatments for illnesses such as Alzheimer’s disease.

I am honored to introduce the Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act of 2017 on behalf of the countless children, women and men who have been sold into modern slavery and robbed of their dignity. Sex trafficking has no place in a just society, and bad actors who run these websites are criminals who belong in prison.

I'm proud of the work we're doing in Missouri and across the country to put an end to the scourge of human trafficking. Did you know that St. Louis was named among the top 20 hot spots in the U.S. for human trafficking? We must put an end to these horrific crimes and I applaud Attorney General Josh Hawley for launching a new task force. I was honored to introduce bipartisan legislation yesterday that will give enforcement officials, prosecutors, and victims the tools they need to help dismantle the human trafficking trade in the United States once and for all. bit.ly/2o2y2XU

Planned Parenthood, an organization that provides 320,000 abortions every year, has begun attacking me as a supposed enemy of women’s healthcare. Nothing could be further from the truth. In Missouri, there are 12 Planned Parenthood facilities scattered across our 114 counties. However, we have 588 health care clinics that prioritize women’s health and wellness, which is why I voted last Congress to increase funding to those very clinics by hundreds of millions of dollars. #ProLife

Today I questioned Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) Director Richard Cordray on the widespread consumer protection failures at the Bureau. Since the CFPB’s creation, we have seen egregious regulations put in place that make it harder for you to qualify for a mortgage, obtain an auto loan, and access other forms of credit that families depend on every day. You deserve better and Director Cordray should step down immediately.

For the first time in eight years, we have a real opportunity to scale back the “Washington knows best” mindset that continually targets your pocketbook and dictates your future. It is time to hold Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) Director Richard Cordray responsible and drain the swamp. I will continue this charge, strapping on my boots as I wade into the Washington swamp to make sure you and your family remain in control of your own future. #CHOICEAct

Last week I was proud to introduce the bipartisan Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act of 2017 to help end the scourge of #humantrafficking and protect the innocent children and women who have been sold into modern slavery and robbed of their dignity.

In February, I proudly presided over the House floor as we voted to strike down an Obama Administration policy that forces states to fund abortion providers.    Today, President Trump signed that resolution into law and restored the rights of states to decide how to distribute Title X funding, ensuring they are not forced to fund abortion providers like Planned Parenthood. #HJRes43 #ProLife
Happy Easter to you and your family as we celebrate this most blessed day!

In honor of #NationalParkWeek, be sure to check out the home where our nation's 18th President Ulysses S. Grant met Julia Dent, his future wife, while he was stationed at Jefferson Barracks in 1844. The home is located in South County right off Gravois Road and the Grants briefly lived there prior to the outbreak of the Civil War. #FindYourPark

Education and awareness are critical tools in the fight against human trafficking. Yesterday, I had the opportunity to witness potentially lifesaving anti-trafficking training at a truck stop in Foristell, MO. Thanks to this training, the TA travel center employees and the hardworking truckers they serve will be better equipped to recognize the signs of human trafficking, helping stamp out this repugnant crime in our communities. As I continue my mission to end trafficking and provide relief for survivors, I am encouraged that the number of Americans fighting this battle on the front lines is growing!

The devastating effects of opioid addiction have been felt around the country and, unfortunately, right here at home. In the St. Louis region, there were more than 650 deaths from overdoses last year. To combat this epidemic, I proudly cosponsored and supported passage of the 21st Century Cures Act last year which included $1 billion to help states confront opioid abuse. Thanks to this legislation, the Missouri Department of Mental Health will receive $10 million dollars to provide addiction treatment for those who desperately need it the most.

This week I had the opportunity to visit two local small businesses that help keep our community and country safe.  FirstSpear is a small business located in Fenton that manufactures and supplies personal protective equipment to our military and law enforcement.  Founded in 2010, FirstSpear continues to expand, creating innovative gear to meet the evolving needs of military and law enforcement personnel.  Our military and law enforcement work every day to keep us safe, and I am proud to see the gear they use is produced right here in #MO2.       EWR Radar Systems in Kirkwood is a small business that produces high-end weather radar systems for the U.S. Department of Defense and commercial clients around the world.  EWR has deployed over 270 radars worldwide that use state of the art weather radar technology. These radars provide our military with the precise weather information they need in order to conduct operations.

As the daughter of a Korean War Veteran and mother of an Army Captain, I made a vow when I first took office to always serve and protect those who serve and protect our great nation. I was honored to be the keynote speaker of the Military Order of the Purple Heart, USA Chapter 125 monument dedication at Jefferson Barracks National Cemetery. Originally known as the “Badge of Military Merit,” it was instituted by General George Washington during the Revolutionary War and is the oldest, continuous military decoration.   I am so proud that this new monument will be a clear and constant reminder of the past sacrifice made by many for our nation, and it should be a beacon of pride for every veteran and active duty soldier protecting us today. I’d like to extend a very special thank you to Chapter 125 Commander Sid Staton who presented me with a Purple Heart Supporter pin.

Since 1976, the Lemay Child and Family Center has been assisting families and providing educational opportunities for children, from infants to middle school. The Center works with each family to ensure strong relationships between parents and children while providing opportunities for each child to strengthen their physical, cognitive and social skills. The Lemay Child & Family Center is an incredible asset to our community and I have never met more dedicated staff and happy children than those whom I met last week. Be sure to check out their website at lemaychildandfamily.org.  Thanks to the leadership of Board President Katy Forand, Vice President Cathy Sansone and Executive Director Denise Wiese, many local families can look forward to a bright and better future. Keep up the great work!

Today, the House Committee on Financial Services is holding a hearing on the Financial #CHOICEAct →  Legislation I support because you deserve more transparency and accountability in Washington, and most of all a stronger economy that boasts a level playing field and spurs job growth and creation. Watch the hearing live here: FinancialCHOICE.gop

I am proud to be an original cosponsor of the Frederick Douglass Trafficking Victims Prevention and Protection Reauthorization Act. It is fitting that this bill is named after Frederick Douglass, the great pioneer of liberty and humanity—a true leader who to this day continues to teach us about the meaning of justice. I am honored that Douglass' great, great, great grandson was able to join us at today's press conference.    It has been 17 years since Congress first passed the Trafficking Victims Protection Act in 2000. The TVPA was the first comprehensive anti-trafficking law in our nation’s history, and it established a wide range of victim service programs that have helped many survivors reintegrate into society.
This week we are recognizing  #SmallBusinessWeek. I am honored to represent the hardworking small business entrepreneurs in #MO2, like the ones I met at Schnarr's Hardware.

Seeing our community and neighbors coming together to help each other in the wake of the flooding in #MO2 has truly been inspiring. Now, with reports of more rain on the way, volunteers are desperately needed across the region, especially in Eureka. If you are able to help, please follow the link below to get involved. #Flood2017

Working with President Trump, the House made real progress for the people of Missouri and fulfilled our promise to provide relief from the Obamacare death spiral. The American Health Care Act will provide more access to affordable health coverage while stabilizing the insurance marketplace, lowering premiums, and reducing our federal debt and taxes. Obamacare has made healthcare completely unaffordable and unworkable for the American people, and I applaud my colleagues for listening to the needs of our families at home and coming together to pass this historic piece of legislation.

Thank you to each of the 54 talented high school students who entered the 2017 2nd Congressional District Art Competition and congratulations to the First Place Winner Nina Marlotte from Parkway South. Nina’s outstanding graphite drawing George will hang in the U.S. Capitol for one year.   I also want to congratulate the 2nd place winner Emma Schumacher and the 3rd place winner Courtney St. John, both from Eureka High School. Emma’s Novelties will hang in my Washington D.C. office and Courtney’s Reflections in my district office for one year.
Such an amazing story of four Rockwood School District facilities employees and their resilience during the flooding last week.

Aetna pulling out of the healthcare exchanges is another example of the unworkable structure of the Affordable Care Act. In Missouri, 96 of 114 counties will only have one insurance provider to choose from. Missourians deserve a healthcare system that will truly be patient-centered, with more choices and lower costs.

For the past 35 years our nation has come together to remember the law enforcement officers who valiantly gave their lives to keep us safe. This year's National Peace Officers' Memorial Service was a solemn moment for the St. Louis area as the name of our very own hero, Officer Blake Snyder, was etched into the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial. Officer Snyder's sacrifice for our community and the strength of his family will never be forgotten.   I join President Trump in his commitment to always protect those who protect us. Next time you see a member of our law enforcement, be sure to tell them thank you.

Today, The Boeing Company announced that St. Louis will be home to the final assembling of the Air Forces’ new training aircraft if they are awarded the project. These jets will ensure that our airmen will be adequately trained to protect our nation. Also, the project will support nearly 2,000 jobs in the region. Creating jobs and expanding our aviation manufacturing base here in St. Louis is critical to establishing Missouri as an innovative and technological leader.    I look forward to celebrating more good news in the future when Boeing is awarded the project.

The I am Jane Doe Film will be released on Netflix on May 26. This documentary chronicles the battle that American mothers are waging on behalf of their middle-school daughters, victims of sex trafficking on Backpage.com. It’s time that we pass my bipartisan bill, the Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act, to end America’s horrific modern-day slave markets.

Since 1962, our nation has dedicated one week out of the year to honor all of our law enforcement officers who valiantly protect us each and every day. It is a privilege to represent the police officers of Missouri’s 2nd District and I will always proudly back the men and women in blue. #PoliceWeek

Inspiring day listening to Eureka's mayor Kevin Coffey, first responders, volunteers, law enforcement, the Army Corps of Engineers, and the Red Cross discuss the response to recent flooding. The amount of volunteer support for Eureka is remarkable and a great example of a community working together.  I also visited Arnold and spoke with Mayor Ron Counts, Jefferson County officials, the Army Corps of Engineers, the Red Cross and State Senator Paul Wieland. I look forward to continued discussions on solutions for this type of flooding in the future.   I, along with Senator Roy Blunt, stand ready to do our part to assist Eureka, Arnold, and all the communities affected by flooding.

It was an honor to fly with these veterans from the Vietnam and Korean wars and even a couple from World War II. They'll be in DC seeing the monuments dedicated to their courage and sacrifice to protect freedom around the world.   So grateful for the volunteers who make the Greater St. Louis Honor Flights possible for our nation's heroes.

Last night the House unanimously passed my legislation, the Put Trafficking Victims First Act. Victims of trafficking have endured horrific trauma, violence, and abuse, but they continue to be overlooked and underserved. This must stop. Victims need help to rebuild their lives and that’s what the Put Trafficking Victims First Act does—improves support, identification, and services for victims of this egregious crime. America needs to afford trafficking victims the same justice, protections, and dignity that other crime victims receive.

Last night I hosted a special order of speeches on human trafficking. Human trafficking is currently one of the most profitable crimes in the world—after the drug trade—and its victims have endured horrific trauma, violence, and abuse.   It is the most precious duty of Congress to safeguard human rights and protections for the most vulnerable members of our society.

This Memorial Day weekend we take time to remember those who have defended our nation and to honor the brave men and women who gave the last full measure of their devotion and are laid to rest both at home and abroad.  As the mother of an active duty Army Ranger serving as a Captain in the 3rd Infantry Division, I don’t take lightly the sacrifices those in uniform make for our country. It was an honor to join the Gold Star families at the historic Jefferson Barracks to dedicate a beautiful new monument to the sacrifice of their loved ones.

In 1972, St. Louis native, Air Force 1Lt Michael J. Blassie was on a ground support mission in South Vietnam, when his A-37 Dragonfly came under intense enemy anti-aircraft fire. Another pilot reported seeing Blassie's aircraft impact the ground near the village of An Loc where it exploded and burned. His remains were once in the Tomb of the Unknown at Arlington National Cemetery until they were identified and he was interred at Jefferson Barracks in 1998. This weekend I visited his grave and paid my respects.   Today we remember those who have defended our nation and honor the brave men and women who gave the last full measure of devotion for their country. #MemorialDay

We must never forget the veterans that fought for our freedom and need to reenter civilian life.   Today, I joined Governor Eric Greitens at the nationwide launch of Charter Communication’s Broadband Technician Apprenticeship that will assist our warriors with job opportunities as they return home. As an Army mom and the daughter of a Korean War veteran, I commend and thank Charter Spectrum for its commitment to hiring veterans.
Thrilled to help New Balance and KaBOOM! build a playground in Gravois Park!  Many volunteers gave up their time to assist in this project today!

FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency has begun registering victims of the disastrous flooding that hit our region last month. If you would like to apply for federal assistance please visit https://www.disasterassistance.gov for more information.

Yesterday, I participated in a House Financial Services Committee hearing on flood insurance to ask about how the private market can take on a bigger role and offer consumers more flexibility and choices when it comes to flood insurance coverage.

Hezbollah is a brutal terrorist organization based in Lebanon that poses a violent threat to the United States and our allies. Yesterday, I joined my colleagues on the House Foreign Affairs Committee to question terrorism financing experts on Hezbollah’s influence over the Lebanese state, Hezbollah’s relations with Iran, and Hezbollah’s human trafficking activities.

Today, I was proud to support our veterans and vote for The Department of Veterans Affairs Accountability and Whistleblower Protection Act. Over the past few years we have heard far too many stories about the inexcusably poor treatment of our nation’s heroes at VA facilities. To make matters worse, the bureaucratic red tape at the VA protected employees who failed to provide our veterans with the care they have earned. This bill will create a more efficient process for removing, demoting, or suspending any VA employees for poor performance or misconduct while still protecting employees’ due process rights. We can all agree that our veterans deserve the utmost respect from the staff at the VA and this bill is a positive step in the right direction.

Yesterday, Republicans and Democrats came together, thanked the brave Capitol Police and first responders that protect us, prayed for those recovering from Wednesday’s vicious attacks, and enjoyed one of America’s favorite pastimes. #CongressionalBaseballGame #ScaliseStrong #TeamScalise

Today I thank my husband Ray for his unwavering love, support, and guidance for our children. I am also thinking of my own father today, he taught me the importance treating others with respect and the value of hard work. I am so thankful for these two wonderful role models. Happy Father's Day to all loving dads across the country!#HappyFathersDay

Another FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency Disaster Recovery Center opens today in Wildwood. It is located in the Greensfelder Park visitor center and will provide in person support for those effected by recent flooding. Be sure to register for assistance online at DisasterAssistance.gov before you visit.

Today, I proudly introduced the Elie Wiesel Genocide and Atrocities Prevention Act of 2017.  From the Holocaust to South Sudan, from Burma to Syria, the world has witnessed far too many genocides and mass atrocity crimes. The true horror is that most of these devastating crises are preventable. My heart aches for those whose lives are being torn apart, and the fact that over 65 million people are currently fleeing preventable crises makes clear that the U.S. Government must improve its response to these conflicts.

The Missouri Department of Natural Resources’ discrimination against Trinity Lutheran Church Child Learning Center—solely because of the center’s religious affiliation—is a clear infringement on the free exercise of religion in Missouri. I applaud the Supreme Court for siding with religious freedom and Trinity Lutheran Church, and I stand with the many faith-based organizations across Missouri that provide valuable services to the community.   As stated in Chief Justice John Roberts’ opinion of the Court, ‘the exclusion of Trinity Lutheran from a public benefit for which it is otherwise qualified, solely because it is a church, is odious to our Constitution…and cannot stand.

Speaker Ryan is right about the legislation the House of Representatives has passed so far this year.  “These are real wins—not for ourselves, not for our party, but for real people. Good policy is the business of improving lives. And for me, good policy has always trumped petty politics. When people’s lives are changed for the better, even when it’s not reported, we’ve done our job.”

I had a great time meeting with the Hoogs & their grandson from Eureka after their tour of the Capitol today. If you or someone you know from the 2nd District is visiting Washington D.C. this summer, be sure to contact my DC office at 202-225-1621 to set up tours of our nation’s capital.

Cities that flagrantly disregard the rule of law must be held accountable for endangering the lives of Americans. Stories like the senseless murder of Kate Steinle by a violent criminal who had seven felonies and had been deported five times are repugnant and preventable. Today, the House voted to block funding for so called “sanctuary cities” who fail to comply with federal immigration laws and increased the penalties for illegal immigrants who reenter the United States.

For 241 years, the United States has stood as a beacon of hope and liberty to the world. Today, as we celebrate the birth of this great nation, let's rededicate ourselves to protecting our freedom and pray for all the brave men and women in our military who risk their lives daily. I hope you enjoy the fireworks and have a happy Independence Day!

Today, I had the opportunity to meet with Stan Brown, President of the Gateway Chapter of the Paralyzed Veterans of America. As the daughter of a veteran and the mother of an active duty Army Captain, I understand the sacrifice our nation’s veterans have made and advocates like Stan ensure that our veterans receive the care they need.

Everyone knows that Backpage is selling innocent women and children into sex slavery. We cannot claim to be anti-trafficking advocates, then close our eyes and give a free pass to the websites that sell our children. My legislation, the Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act, would finally hold Backpage responsible for its modern-day slave market and give victims across America access to justice.

Today, my colleague Carolyn Maloney and I sent a joint letter to U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions calling on the Department of Justice to open an immediate criminal investigation into Backpage.com’s knowing advertisement and facilitation of online sex trafficking.
Last week the House passed several important bills to combat human trafficking. However, this fight is far from over.
Everyone has a role in the fight to eliminate #sextrafficking. Join me at 2pm to hear more about what we are doing.
48 years ago today, two brave astronauts set foot on the surface of the moon and became a historic, shining example of American achievement.

As a reminder, we are under an excessive heat warning until 8pm on Saturday. Be sure to drink plenty of water and stay out of the heat when you can. If you or someone you know needs assistance, be sure to visit cooldownstlouis.org.
I'll be joining Family Research Council in about an hour to discuss how we can fight #humantrafficking. Be sure to tune in!

This week, Congress reaffirmed our nation's stance against murderous, tyrannical regimes like Russia, Iran, and North Korea. The House Foreign Affairs Committee is committed to holding corrupt dictators accountable and advancing justice for some of the world’s most repressed populations.

The House of Representatives just passed The Make America Secure Appropriations Act which ensures military preparedness, takes care of our veterans, fully funds President Trump’s request for the border wall, and provides the largest pay raise for our troops in over 8 years.  Along with important funding for 24 F/A-18E/F Super Hornets and the new NGA facility in north St. Louis, this bill included my amendment for an increase of $5 million for the Fisher House Foundation. These homes, like the one I visited at Jefferson Barracks in October, provide military families housing close to a loved one during hospitalization.
Looking for something fun to do outside during the beautiful weather this week? Check out this guide.

Please join me in congratulating the academy appointees for the class of 2021. I am proud these brave young men and women are representing the St. Louis area at the United States Service Academies. As the mother of a United States Military Academy graduate, the privilege of nominating outstanding candidates to each of the academies is a responsibility I take very seriously.

This week, the Lindbergh School District cut the ribbon on its sixth elementary school, Dressel Elementary.  More and more families continue to move into Lindbergh because of its growing reputation as a top-notch school district in our area, and this new school will help welcome the influx of new students.  The 2017-2018 school year begins in just a couple of weeks, and I'm sure Principal Craig Hamby and his team will do a great job at this new facility!

Like Abraham Lincoln said in 1860, "Let us have faith that right makes might." I am so thankful for all the partners we have working together to do what is right even in the face of opposition. We knew this fight was going to be difficult but together we will amend #CDA230. http://bit.ly/2u8GVzr

In honor of #PurpleHeartDay, we recognize the sacrifice of the brave men and women who are recipients of the Purple Heart. It was an honor to meet some of the local recipients of our nation’s oldest, continuous military decoration at the Military Order of the Purple Heart, USA Chapter 125 monument dedication at Jefferson Barracks National Cemetery.
It is time to hold companies like Backpage accountable. #endhumantrafficking #CDA230

#CDA230 was never intended to create a lawless internet where people can commit sex crimes online that they cannot commit offline. Google's support for companies like Backpage while punishing its employees for their views is hypocritical.

Today, I was honored to join 200 Marine Reservists and their loved ones during their family day activities at the Marine Reserve Center. At a time when the United States is under constant threat from foreign entities, it is reassuring to know that these brave men and women are willing to do whatever it takes to protect us.

The ability to live the American dream - to work hard, change jobs, be promoted, start a business, support your family - is a blessing that I believe all of us should be able to share.  The American dream should also include an environment of robust debate and civil discourse, but should never foster or tolerate hatred, bigotry, or intolerance - as witnessed yesterday in Charlottesville. And leaders must call out Neo-Nazis, white supremacists and fascists by name.

Yesterday I left with several of my colleagues on a congressional delegation trip to Japan, China, and South Korea. The trip will focus on promoting stronger diplomatic and economic partnerships in the region. Now, given North Korea’s recent acts of aggression, these goals are even more important. I look forward to meeting with officials from these countries as well as our U.S. representatives in the region to increase diplomatic engagement, expand and enforce sanctions, and enhance military cooperation in the region.   Our first stop of the trip was in Hawaii where we met with members of the U.S. Navy and toured the World War II Valor In The Pacific National Monument at Pearl Harbor. It was an awe-inspiring reminder of the courageous servicemembers who gave the ultimate sacrifice to defend our freedom.   https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/as-tensions-mount-from-threat-of-north-korea-wagner-leaves-on
NA
‪Visited the DMZ between North & South Korea. Yes, that is a North Korean soldier staring at us through the window.

The goal of the Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act is to ensure that survivors of sex trafficking have full access to seek justice. If passed, it will bring us one step closer to that goal.
For those of you looking to help our neighbors to the south affected by #Harvey, here is a link to organizations offering assistance.

Yesterday’s missile test is an unfortunate reminder that tensions with North Korea are not deescalating. I recently returned from an official visit to the China, South Korea, and Japan along with several colleagues from both the House and Senate.  We discussed our response to North Korea’s recent provocations and how cooperation between our nations can help bring Kim Jong-Un’s regime to the negotiating table.

I commend all those involved who worked hard to ensure the selection process for this $1.75 billion federal construction project was fair. I am excited that this new state of the art facility which is vital to our national security will remain in St. Louis.
It was a pleasure to visit the RGA headquarters in Chesterfield and meet the wonderful employees. Thank you to the nearly 300 Missourians who attended the employee townhall, I enjoyed the discussion!

Today we mark International Overdose Awareness Day and remember all of the those who have been lost to this nationwide epidemic. Just last year, Congress passed the 21st Century Cures Act which allocated $1 billion for opioid prevention and treatment, but there is still more work to be done.   In St. Louis alone, there were over 700 overdoses in the last year and that number is expected to grow. One thing is clear, our friends, families, and neighbors struggling with addiction need our help; we must act now.

Hurricane Harvey devastated areas across Texas and Louisiana leaving hundreds of thousands of victims of catastrophic flooding and destruction in its wake. The critical aid package passed by the House today includes the full amount requested by the Administration and ensures all response and recovery needs are swiftly met.   As we send our thoughts, prayers, and support to these communities, it is imperative that we continue to prioritize investment in recovery and relief for those impacted by these disasters.

I am thankful that leaders like Oracle in the big tech industry are supporting the fight against sex trafficking. Amending Section 230 of the CDA is the only way to ensure companies like Backpage.com are unable to commit sex trafficking crimes online that they cannot commit offline. Anyone thinking with their conscience instead of their pocket book would agree.

I promised the people of St. Charles, Jefferson, and St. Louis Counties that I would go to Washington to cut up the government's credit card and put a stop to wasteful federal government spending. What Congress voted on today did neither. Tying reckless spending policy to desperately needed emergency disaster relief sums up what people, myself included, hate about Washington politics. Today should have been about providing emergency resources for disaster relief and recovery, not playing beltway politics and punting on our national debt.
#NeverForget those we lost, the bravery of the first responders, & how this day united our nation to stand against evil. #September11th

For the first time in more than a decade, the U.S. House of Representatives passed all 12 appropriations bills to responsibly fund the federal government and advance the conservative Republican principles we promised to pursue. The appropriations work we completed today prioritizes the needs of the American people, cuts wasteful government spending, and takes concrete steps to help lift up Missouri’s families and small businesses. These bills include big wins for the St. Louis region and underscore my commitment to defending life, supporting and strengthening our military, and energizing the local economy. http://bit.ly/2x25IYd
‪‪For 230 years, our Constitution has embodied the ideals of a free people. It is our duty to continue defending these ideals. #ConstitutionDay‬

Today, I met with community leaders, medical professionals, and first responders to discuss the opioid epidemic's impact on our communities and families. Just last week, the house voted to increase funding to combat the opioid crisis, including $747 million to help stem opioid abuse.   However, opioid related deaths continue to rise nationwide and will continue to do so until our nation fights this issue head on. We can start right now by raising awareness during Prescription Opioid and Heroin Epidemic Awareness Week.

I was honored to speak at the launch of Fontbonne University’s Advanced Skills Training in Human Trafficking Program. Education and awareness are vital in the fight against human trafficking, and this program will equip those on the frontlines in our communities with the tools they need to help. I am grateful for Fontbonne President Dr. Michael Pressimone and Incarnate Word Foundation Executive Director Bridget Flood, who have brought their institutions together to launch this program.

I was delighted to join with Rep. Carolyn Maloney in welcoming Korean Foreign Minister Kang Kyung-wha to Washington, D.C. Prioritizing dialogue with our South Korean colleagues helps Congress better address the North Korean threat as we press for denuclearization on the Korean Peninsula.  Foreign Minister Kang is a remarkable world leader, and our discussion on North Korea is a step forward in mutual understanding on issues ranging from comprehensive missile defense to strengthening the U.S.-South Korea alliance.

When people stop me in the grocery store, they always mention two things: they want to keep more of their hard-earned paycheck and they want to know that their jobs are safe. The tax reform framework released today will accomplish both of these goals. It provides greater tax relief for families through increased standard deductions and child tax credits. This means that Missouri families will be able to keep more of their money, they will be able save for braces or education or an unexpected expense.   Furthermore, by fixing the broken tax code for businesses, we can make America more competitive globally and make sure that good-paying jobs here at home are more secure. It's been over 30 years since we have reformed our tax code and I am encouraged by this positive step forward on one of our key legislative priorities.
I'm at the United Nations headquarters today to discuss online sex trafficking & what we can do to stop it. Watch it live --> http://bit.ly/2xMPxk2 #UNGA

This week, I questioned Deputy Secretary of State John Sullivan about the State Department's plan to reduce waste to create a more lean and accountable agency. I also asked about the efforts to promote more diplomacy in Asia, specifically in the ASEAN region, and how the U.S. can address the ongoing religious persecution in Burma.

Shared Hope International, ECPAT International, and the National Center on Sexual Exploitation are hosting an important briefing about the fight to end online human trafficking by amending section 230 of the Communications Decency Act. You can watch the briefing live here at 2pm eastern https://www.facebook.com/centeronexploitation/
The House just passed legislation that protects unborn children like my granddaughter! #ProLife #TheyFeelPain

We must continue the fight to end human trafficking. Last Friday, I spoke at the United Nations about the explosive growth of online trafficking, and all week I have been meeting with countless advocates who traveled to Washington D.C. to support my bill. The Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act, would amend Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act to hold Backpage.com, and countless other websites, accountable for facilitating human trafficking. My bill received its first hearing in the House Judiciary committee this week.   On Tuesday, I hosted a briefing about my bill with congressional staff and attended a screening of the powerful I am Jane Doe Film to highlight the plight of trafficking survivors like J.S., whose story is featured in the film. I want to personally thank J.S. and her mother for coming to the Capitol to share their story with Speaker Paul Ryan, Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy, and many others. While I am inspired by the passion for justice I witnessed this week, the battle is far from over and I will continue to fight for my bill to be voted on by the House.
One year ago, our community lost a hero in the line of duty. Remembering St. Louis County Police Department Officer Blake Snyder and praying for his family today.

This week, the House passed the Pain Capable Unborn Child Protection Act. This life saving measure will prevent elective abortions after a baby is 20 weeks old--which is when a child begins to feel pain in the womb.   I spoke on the House floor in support of this bill next to the ultrasound of my first granddaughter who will be joining the Wagner family next year. She is a gift from God, a gift that we have too often abandoned as a country. I encourage my colleagues in the Senate to take up this important piece of legislation so babies like her are protected.

With tensions rising, North Korea continues to be a destabilizing force in the region and around the world. We must continue to impose additional secondary sanctions and work with our allies in the region to isolate Kim Jong-un’s regime and peacefully denuclearize the Korean peninsula.   For far too long, this regime has gotten away with developing nuclear and military capabilities, threatening countries around the world, and committing grave human rights and labor trafficking abuses against its people. It is time for a stronger, more comprehensive North Korea policy.

The greatest threat facing the United States and our allies in the Middle East is a nuclear Iran. From day one I stood firmly against the dangerous Iran nuclear agreement struck by the Obama Administration. This deal was a fundamental mistake that weakened U.S. credibility to push back on Iran; and it would ultimately allow the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps to access funds and equipment from abroad to use against our allies.   I applaud President Trump’s decision to decertify Iran’s compliance with this flawed deal, and the Foreign Affairs Committee will work with House Leadership and the President to develop a comprehensive strategy to confront Iran’s destabilizing actions.

It was an honor to speak to the Knights of Columbus Council #7119 at St. Clare of Assisi in Ellisville and present them with a flag flown over the Capitol building. I am extremely grateful for the servant leadership this organization displays throughout our community.

This week, there is something you can do to fight the opioid epidemic in our community. Look around your house, find that hidden cupboard, and see if you have old prescriptions. I bet you do. On Saturday, find your nearest drug takeback location and throw them away.   Together we can restore hope in the fight against opioid addiction but it won’t happen overnight. It will take work, prayer, patience, and vigilance.  #TakeBackDay

This Saturday is National #TakeBackDay. We all have a role to play in the fight against the opioid epidemic that is devastating our nation. You can help by visiting https://takebackday.dea.gov/, finding a drop off location, and disposing your prescription drugs. We need to prevent our loved ones from being dragged into the abyss of addiction and hopelessness.

Today is #DEATakeBack day. You can do your part in the fight against the opioid crisis by visiting https://takebackday.dea.gov/, finding a drop off location near you, and disposing of your unused prescription drugs.

Great turnout across the area for #DEATakeBack day! Today, we came together as a community and that is how we can and will restore hope in the fight against opioid addiction.   I'd like to give a special thank you to the St. Louis County Police Department Officers at the 4th Precinct in South County I had the privilege of meeting. Our local officers, who do an amazing job keeping us safe, were just a few of the many law enforcement officers out collecting opioids all across the country.

Thank you to the hundreds of concerned Missourians who came to Kirkwood High School to learn about the fight against online human trafficking. I was encouraged by the number of people who gathered to watch the premiere of such a powerful documentary.   The I am Jane Doe Film chronicles the legal roadblocks victims and their families face as they seek to hold websites that profit from trafficking accountable. One of those a cases was from right here in St. Louis. Together we are raising awareness and giving a voice to the most vulnerable in our society.

The HUD Office of Inspector General has routinely identified serious systemic problems with the CDBG Disaster Recovery Program and money has often failed to reach those who need it most.    Today, my subcommittee held a hearing on how to eliminate this waste, fraud, and abuse. We must ensure disaster relief dollars go directly to Americans in need.

To all those who have weighed in and told me that you wanted to keep more of your hard-earned paycheck, your voices have been heard. Today the House took an historic leap towards delivering on our promises of more jobs, fairer taxes, and bigger paychecks. For far too long, Missouri families have been struggling to earn a pay raise or put away money for the future. By permanently lowering rates, boosting family-focused tax benefits, and eliminating taxes that disadvantage hardworking Americans, we will finally put American families first.
‪Ran into Greater St. Louis Honor Flight veterans while visiting the Vietnam Veterans Memorial with my family. I am grateful for their courage & sacrifice. Honored to have met them.‬
This chair will be a silent reminder of the brave men & women who have been held as prisoners of war & those MIA. Honored to attend the dedication ceremony in the Capitol.
My staff & I spent #VeteransDay at Jefferson Barracks with brave Americans who served our nation. Thank you to all the men & women who answered the call to defend our freedom.

The nearly $700 billion in funding for our military approved by the House in the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2018 (NDAA) will not only be critical in protecting our nation from rising foreign threats but it will be a huge asset to the local economy. Included in this legislation is funding for construction of the new NGA headquarters in North St. Louis and 24 new F/A-18E/F Super Hornets—which will also be built locally. Both of these projects will support thousands of jobs across our community and play a vital role in aiding our troops around the world.  The NDAA will also increase the size of our military and give our servicemen and women a well-deserved pay raise. Additionally, we permanently secured survivors benefits for more than 60,000 Americans whose spouse died either on active duty or during retirement. Today, we fulfilled our promise to keep Americans safe and free, and we gave our troops the support they deserve.
The people of Missouri’s 2nd District sent me to Washington to secure their jobs and make sure they get to keep more of their hard earned money. At long last, we are doing just that.  #TaxReform

I support the President’s decision to designate North Korea as a state sponsor of terrorism and was proud to support efforts in the U..S. House of Representatives calling for this designation. We must hold rogue states—like North Korea—accountable for threatening and destabilizing activities.
My husband Ray & I were proud to join our Ballwin community to dedicate Officer Flamion’s new smart home built by the Gary Sinise Foundation.

I applaud today's verdict finding Ratko Mladic guilty of genocide & war crimes. The Bosnian community & the world have waited for Mladic to face the consequences of his actions. I am pleased to know this monster will spend the rest of his days behind bars.‬

As we gather around our table with our loved ones this Thanksgiving to celebrate all the blessings we have received this past year, my husband Ray and I give thanks to God for his grace, guidance, and strength. We also ask you to join us in remembering and thanking the American soldiers who are away from their families and friends this holiday season. Their sacrifices ensure that we can continue to enjoy the blessings and freedoms of this great nation.  From my family to yours, may you have a blessed Thanksgiving and thank you for trusting me as your Representative in Washington, D.C.

The people of the 2nd District sent me to Washington to secure their jobs and fight to keep more of their hard earned money. Now—with the President’s continued support—Congress is finally on the verge of doing just that. The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act will reignite the American economy, it will make every day a little bit easier for that single mother of two, that firefighter, or that small-business owner. And it will give the local St. Charles businesses the President mentioned today more money to grow their businesses, provide goods and services to our community, and create jobs.

Today, I testified before the House Energy & Commerce Committee about my bill, the Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act (FOSTA). FOSTA would allow state and local prosecutors to take down websites that facilitate trafficking before they ever reach the size and scope of Backpage. FOSTA has a strong bipartisan coalition of 171 co-sponsors and I was honored to testify on behalf of the most vulnerable members of our society.
I ask you to join me in continued prayer for Officer O'Connor, his family, and the brave men and women of the Arnold MO Police Department during this difficult time.
76 years later, the date still lives in infamy. May we never forget the lives lost at Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941. #NeverForget #PearlHarborRemembranceDay
To all of those celebrating with their loved ones. #HappyHanukkah
President Trump has signed #FY18NDAA into law. This important bill ensures our military is prepared to respond to threats around the globe and will support thousands of jobs across our community.

Today we celebrate the 226 year anniversary of the ratification of the first ten amendments to the U.S. Constitution. It is my honor to protect these rights each and every day as a member of Congress. #BillofRightsDay

In 2012, the people of Missouri's 2nd Congressional District sent me to Congress, and I promised them that I would find a way for families to keep more of their hard-earned money. Today, we are delivering on that promise and no media hyperbole or partisan backlash will change the bottom line. This bill cuts taxes for middle income Missourians, allows American businesses to flourish, and paves the way for an increase of good-paying jobs.  The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act is pro-family tax reform that expands the Child Tax Credit, doubles the standard deduction, lowers individual rates, and preserves the adoption tax credit and retirement savings options I fought hard to keep. Most importantly—after 30 years of a ballooning tax code—this historic tax reform sets the stage for American families and our economy to prosper.
Thank you for the privilege of serving Missouri's 2nd Congressional District. From the entire Wagner family, we wish you God’s blessings for a very Merry Christmas.

On this day in 1945, Congress officially recognized the Pledge of Allegiance. Each time we stand and put our hands over our hearts to recite it, we are reminded of what makes our nation great. #pledgeofallegianceday
Ray and I wish you and your loved ones a happy, healthy and prosperous New Year!

As I head back to Washington, D.C. today, I am grateful for the time I was able to spend with family and friends back home in Ballwin over the holidays. From an Army Football W in the Heart of Dallas Bowl to hunting with Ray, Raymond and Julia, plenty of lasting memories were made. Tomorrow I will be sworn into the 115th Congress representing Missouri's Second Congressional District and I am humbled and blessed to serve you for another two years.

Earlier today, I was sworn into the 115th Congress, and I took an oath to support and defend the Constitution of the United States. I am looking forward to this continued opportunity, working closely with the Trump Administration, to repeal many overreaching regulations and executive orders that have placed burdens on you and your families over the past 8 years. I'd like to thank my loving husband Ray and my three children for their unwavering support as I rededicate myself to serving you and our community. Thank you for your trust in me, and I look forward to seeing many of you soon, both in Washington and here at home.

Outgoing presidential administrations frequently rush into place high-cost or politically driven regulations during their last days and months in office. This week, the House will vote on legislation to help block President Obama's executive overreach and 11th hour regulations that are hurting Missouri families. #MidnightRules #REINSAct

Skyrocketing premium costs coupled with the fact that 96 of Missouri’s 114 counties will have only one insurance carrier under #Obamacare this year is a cause for immediate action. It is time we repeal and replace this failed law with a free market solution that provides every American with access to quality, affordable health coverage.

I am grateful for Chairman Hensarling's trust in me to lead the House Committee on Financial Services Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations for the 115th Congress. The Obama years have seen a rise of imperial Washington, D.C., with the crushing weight of regulations harming small businesses and families from the coasts to the heartland. Over the next several months and years, we will expose the damage the old administration caused to our national economy while detailing what the new and hopeful administration will do to restore the American family.

Our Founding Fathers believed so strongly in our right to keep and bear arms that they enshrined it in the 2nd Amendment of the Constitution. While you don’t need a concealed carry permit in Missouri, I am a big proponent of gun safety and taking a state-approved training course - and getting a concealed carry permit.   I also believe if you have received a concealed carry permit in one state, you should be able to carry your firearm in another state that recognizes the same right to carry a concealed firearm. This is why I am a proud cosponsor of the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act of 2017. Passing this legislation is a critical step in protecting our Constitutional Rights. More info here: http://bit.ly/2i1hvQS
Thank you to all of our law enforcement officers for your indispensable service to our community. You have my respect and I will always have your back.

President Obama recently violated the faith of the American people and trampled on our ally, Israel, by abstaining from a United Nations vote to censure Israel. The Administration’s destructive decision to undercut Israel has given leverage to anti-Israel boycotters and anti-Semites around the world. This act screamed of personal vengeance and hostility, directly harmed American interests, and undermined peace in the Middle East. I look forward to the Trump Administration who will support Israel and refuse to abandon our allies on the world stage.

Today is National #HumanTraffickingAwarenessDay - while many believe that this heinous crime doesn’t exist in our own neighborhoods, the greater St. Louis metro region has been identified as one of the top 20 hot spots for human trafficking in the country.  Today I introduced legislation, the Trafficking Survivors Relief Act, which would allow judges to grant relief to victims for non-violent crimes that were committed as a direct result of being trafficked, setting them on a course toward a successful future.  I hope you will share this post to join me in raising awareness and working to eradicate this horrific crime - survivors deserve a chance to reestablish their lives.

#ICYMI: Yesterday was National #HumanTraffickingAwarenessDay. I introduced legislation to help survivors who have been convicted of crimes that were committed as a direct result of being trafficked - these men, women and children deserve a chance to reestablish their lives. http://bit.ly/2jc3xgq

My common-sense legislation, the SEC Regulatory Accountability Act that just passed out of the U.S. House, will help drain the swamp that Washington bureaucrats have built over the past eight years.   Whether it is buying a car or choosing a college savings plan, every American family weighs the pros and cons before making major life decisions. The SEC Regulatory Accountability Act simply requires that the Commission engages in the same process and can justify that the benefits of a proposed regulation will outweigh its costs - something our regulators should already be doing. #BetterWay http://bit.ly/2jJywkB
Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s vision for a better, stronger American still stands today.

I am thrilled to add my voice and experience to the House Foreign Affairs Committee during this Congress as we confront the damage caused by eight years of failed Obama foreign policy. I am eager to work with my colleagues to rejuvenate American global leadership, fortify our alliances, and construct a credible political and security architecture that will deter aggression and promote U.S. values and interests. http://bit.ly/2ilsQwG

I am so proud of Matt Holliday and his wife Leslee for their commitment to improving the lives of patients at SSM Health Cardinal Glennon Children’s Hospital. Last night’s Holliday’s Heroes dinner was wonderful and I know Matt Carpenter will do great things serving as the new Chairman of #HomersforHealth. http://bit.ly/2jGGyYa

This morning, I had the honor of presenting the Air Force Commendation Medal to Staff Sergeant Thomas James for his meritorious service as a Broadcast Specialist in San Vito, Italy, from May 1972 to March 1974.  Sergeant James made significant contributions to the San Vito community during his time of service. It was a privilege to congratulate Mr. James on this great achievement with the help of representatives from the Missouri Air Guard.

Yesterday, I was happy to present overdue retirement flags that were flown over the US Capitol building on Veterans Day to Mr. Harry Hope and Mr. Steve Lovell for their years of service with the United States Armed Forces. Please join me in thanking these men for their service to our nation.

Today, I congratulate Donald J. Trump as he is sworn in as the 45th President of the United States of America. Under President Trump, I am confident we will have new opportunities to invest in our future and a renewed sense of hope for our children and grandchildren. From this day forward we will be steadfast in our reserve to restore the rule of law, strengthen our economy, bolster our national defense, protect our servicemen and veterans, and support our first responders. From the coasts to the heartland, we will Make America Great Again.
Prayers for my friend, Anne Allred.

Today, I spoke on the House floor in favor of the No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion Act. This bill would make the Hyde Amendment permanent, ensuring that the profits of big abortion should not be pilfered off the hard work of the American citizen. #HR7 #WomensHealthNotAbortion

This past weekend, I was happy to present our new Governor, Eric Greitens, with a flag that was flown over the United States Capitol on the day he was sworn in as the 56th Governor of the State of Missouri.

Fighting for the right to life is my most precious responsibility as a member of Congress. I am so grateful that my own parents, and my beautiful mother-in-law, Loretto Wagner who began the annual caravan, shared this respect for the vulnerable unborn. Many times I rode the bus from St. Louis to D.C. for The March for Life and I am looking forward to seeing so many of you tomorrow for this incredible event.

Fighting for the right to life is my most precious responsibility as a member of Congress. I am so grateful that my own parents, and my beautiful mother-in-law, Loretto Wagner, shared this respect for the vulnerable unborn. They taught me that standing up for these children is the greatest way I can serve my country. I was thrilled to welcome so many of you to Washington, D.C. today for The March for Life #WhyWeMarch #ProLife

It is a remarkable time for our country when we have the opportunity to finally say YES to life, and NO to taxpayer dollars for abortions. This is an amazing accomplishment for defenders of life, but our years-long battle to defund Planned Parenthood continues and is just the tip of the iceberg. Thank you for marching today in The March for Life, to give a voice to the voiceless - you are brave warriors in defense of life! #WhyWeMarch #ProLife

President Donald J. Trump has taken an important step in restoring balance to the Supreme Court by nominating a fervent champion of true conservative values. Judge Gorsuch’s strong credentials will bring a commitment to the principles of the Court and our Constitution, worthy of Justice Antonin Scalia’s legacy. The Senate should respect the rights of the American people and quickly confirm President Trump’s pick for the next Supreme Court Justice. #SCOTUS

I spent time with four young women at The Covering House this fall, listening to their heartbreaking stories as survivors of human sex trafficking. The Trafficking Survivors Relief Act, legislation I introduced earlier this year, would help set them on a course toward a more successful future. Yesterday I met with members of the National District Attorneys Association to seek their help in prosecuting criminals of human trafficking. As a mother, sister, and a lawmaker, I will work tirelessly to identify victims and ensure survivors have the best opportunities for a better life.

U.S. Department of Labor Secretary nominee and St. Louis native Andy Puzder will get Americans back to work. He will protect workers’ rights, and he will ensure that businesses and workers have every opportunity to succeed.  I've known Andy for many years - he understands the importance of putting political differences aside and working together toward shared goals. President Donald J. Trump made an excellent choice for Secretary of Labor.
Joining my friends at Live Action to defend the unborn.

As a member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee and a former U.S. Ambassador, I believe deeply in the power of American leadership at the international bargaining table. I am confident that under a new Administration led by President Donald J. Trump, our country can start acting like a leader by confronting—instead of acquiescing to—the UN’s radical bias against Israel.

Today is a great day for low- and middle-income American families! With President Donald J. Trump's executive order to delay the U.S. Department of Labor Fiduciary Rule, we're listening to the concerns of everyday Americans and protecting their ability to access retirement investment advice. I will continue working toward a permanent, legislative solution in Congress to help preserve investment choice, access and affordability while ensuring you can receive investment advice that is truly in your best interest.
This amazing story is proof that education and awareness are critical in the fight against human trafficking.

During a House Foreign Affairs Committee hearing earlier today, I made it clear that global sanctions efforts, in combination with the Obama Administration’s policy of strategic patience, failed to disrupt growth of the North Korean economy or to advance denuclearization. Clearly there is much work to be done, but for North Korea to give up its nuclear program, the regime must feel that a de-nuclearized North Korea with good U.S. relations would be superior to a nuclearized North Korea with bad U.S. relations.
Had a great time this morning visiting with students from Cor Jesu Academy St. Louis and St. John Vianney High School!
NA

I was grateful to meet with Missouri narcotic officers Lieutenant Jason Grellner and Sergeant Scott Reed this week. These men are dedicated public servants who are committed to ending addiction and drug-related violence in Missouri. We discussed the fight against methamphetamine and opioids, and I learned about Missouri innovators who are developing new forms of Pseudoephedrine that can’t be converted into meth. I am grateful for the leadership of local law enforcement in ending the devastating disease of addiction.

It was my honor to drop by the  Concordance Academy of Leadership's family dinner last night. It is not enough to say we must do something to help families in transition and help bring about a stronger community, and that's why the work being done at Concordance Academy is so impressive. The staff and leadership of people like Jeff Smith and Danny Ludeman is impressive, but the individuals and families I had the opportunity to visit with last night was even more inspiring.   Check them out at www.concordanceacademy.com. Things are happening in our area to bring people together and build a stronger community, and Concordance is leading the way.
So glad baseball is right around the corner, looking forward to a big year from our St. Louis Cardinals. #Cardinalsnation

The Post-Dispatch got it wrong...    Andy Puzder knows that business and workers need each other.  There are no jobs without business; there is no labor without jobs; and there is no business without labor.  And the more jobs there are, the greater the demand for labor to do them, and the higher wages will go because of the increased demand.  Andy lived that truth both as a young worker and as a mature CEO, which is exactly why the nation’s workers really need him to become Secretary of Labor.

Since the Dodd-Frank Act was passed, the Federal Reserve has continued to expand its authority and power, enforcing burdensome, "Washington-knows-best" regulations on Americans. During a House Committee on Financial Services hearing today, I questioned Chairman Janet Yellen on her plans to implement even more top-down regulations that are hurting our families. Watch here:

Congratulations to Collin Limp from Saint Louis Priory School who has been appointed to West Point - The U.S. Military Academy! It was an honor to give Collin the news today and thank him for his dedication to our country.

I was proud to preside over the House floor today as we voted to strike down an Obama Administration policy that forces states to fund abortion providers. Today's vote restores the rights of states to decide how to distribute Title X funding, ensuring they are not forced to fund abortion providers like Planned Parenthood. #HJRes43 #ProLife

This week Humana announced that it would be leaving the Obamacare marketplace in 2018. Our Republican-led Congress understands that we need to implement an open-market system, which is why we are working to build a healthcare system that will truly be patient-centered, with more choices and lower costs.
